alert.note: Alert for Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 7:04PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Cherry, northwestern Brown and southwestern Keya Paha Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 704 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Norden to 6 miles south of Johnstown. Movement was west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Johnstown, Norden, Wood Lake, North River Trail and Sparks. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 219 and 235. Highway 12 between mile markers 17 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
